tr.td:
This id may be set equal to (a pointer to) an id on a participant elsewhere in the document (header or entries) or a new author participant can be described here. If the id is pointing to a participant already described elsewhere in the document, assignedAuthor/id is sufficient to identify this participant and none of the remaining details of assignedAuthor are required to be set. Application Software must be responsible for resolving the identifier back to its original object and then rendering the information in the correct place in the containing section's narrative text. This id must be a pointer to another author participant.
1098-32628: If the ID isn't referencing an author described elsewhere in the document, then the author components required in US Realm Header are required here as well (CONF:1098-32628).

tr.td:
code
Binding: https://cts.nlm.nih.gov/fhir/ValueSet/2.16.840.1.114222.4.11.1066 (preferred)
1098-32315: If the content is patient authored the code **SHOULD** be selected from Personal And Legal Relationship Role Type (2.16.840.1.113883.11.20.12.1) (CONF:1098-32315).

a.title: Legend for this format

description.value:
This template represents the Author Participation (including the author timestamp). CDA R2 requires that Author and Author timestamp be asserted in the document header. From there, authorship propagates to contained sections and contained entries, unless explicitly overridden.
The Author Participation template was added to those templates in scope for analysis in R2. Although it is not explicitly stated in all templates the Author Participation template can be used in any template.

definition.value: If a value is an exceptional value (NULL-value), this specifies in what way and why proper information is missing.
When valued in an instance, this attribute signals the imposition of realm-specific constraints. The value of this attribute identifies the realm in question

When valued in an instance, this attribute signals the imposition of constraints defined in an HL7-specified message type. This might be a common type (also known as CMET in the messaging communication environment), or content included within a wrapper. The value of this attribute provides a unique identifier for the type in question.
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] templateId (CONF:1098-32017) such that it
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] templateId (CONF:1098-32017) such that it
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] time (CONF:1098-31471).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] assignedAuthor (CONF:1098-31472).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] templateId (CONF:1098-32017) such that it
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] templateId (CONF:1098-32017) such that it
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] time (CONF:1098-31471).
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] assignedAuthor (CONF:1098-31472).

label.value: This id may be set equal to (a pointer to) an id on a participant elsewhere in the document (header or entries) or a new author participant can be described here. If the id is pointing to a participant already described elsewhere in the document, assignedAuthor/id is sufficient to identify this participant and none of the remaining details of assignedAuthor are required to be set. Application Software must be responsible for resolving the identifier back to its original object and then rendering the information in the correct place in the containing section's narrative text. This id must be a pointer to another author participant.

short.value: This id may be set equal to (a pointer to) an id on a participant elsewhere in the document (header or entries) or a new author participant can be described here. If the id is pointing to a participant already described elsewhere in the document, assignedAuthor/id is sufficient to identify this participant and none of the remaining details of assignedAuthor are required to be set. Application Software must be responsible for resolving the identifier back to its original object and then rendering the information in the correct place in the containing section's narrative text. This id must be a pointer to another author participant.

definition.value: This assignedAuthor SHALL contain at least one [1..*] id (CONF:1098-31473).

human.value: If the ID isn't referencing an author described elsewhere in the document, then the author components required in US Realm Header are required here as well (CONF:1098-32628).

definition.value: This assignedAuthor SHOULD contain zero or one [0..1] code, which SHOULD be selected from ValueSet Healthcare Provider Taxonomy urn:oid:2.16.840.1.114222.4.11.1066 DYNAMIC (CONF:1098-31671).

human.value: If the content is patient authored the code **SHOULD** be selected from Personal And Legal Relationship Role Type (2.16.840.1.113883.11.20.12.1) (CONF:1098-32315).

definition.value: This assignedAuthor MAY contain zero or one [0..1] assignedPerson (CONF:1098-31474).
The assignedPerson, if present, MAY contain zero or more [0..*] name (CONF:1098-31475).
This assignedAuthor MAY contain zero or one [0..1] representedOrganization (CONF:1098-31476).
The representedOrganization, if present, MAY contain zero or more [0..*] id (CONF:1098-31478).
The representedOrganization, if present, MAY contain zero or more [0..*] name (CONF:1098-31479).
The representedOrganization, if present, MAY contain zero or more [0..*] telecom (CONF:1098-31480).
The representedOrganization, if present, MAY contain zero or more [0..*] addr (CONF:1098-31481).
